Posts.Content: Hi elena, I am day 15 after my first fec. I also was in hospital for 4 days due to nausea and being unable to eat, drink or take my anti sickness meds. My onc has suggested a syringe driver for my meds for my next chemo next week. What has yours suggested?
Posts.Title: 1st lot of FEC

Posts.Content: I was thinking exactly the same about your ex jmp, you are well rid. At my chemo suite you are allowed one person to accompany you, I don't think I would be able to do it otherwise. I know a friend of mine in another hospital was told only her first chemo she could have someone with her but she insisted her husband was with her at all appointments and they let him. So sorry to hear of your experience :-(
Posts.Title: tv advert

Posts.Content: Well done, what a great feeling xx
Posts.Title: I did it!! ðŸ˜œ

Posts.Content: Hi suze, sorry to hear you are going through all this. I start chemo this coming Wednesday, so just before you, and I am not afraid to say I am terrified at the thought. However now I have made the decision I just want to get it started and over with ASAP. It is a hard decision to make but only you can make it. Good luck with whatever you choose. Hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Hi ... and help please!!

Posts.Content: My surgeon was a lady so no crush!!! Go to meet oncologist tomorrow who's a lady too so no crush there either. Just my luck really :-) x
Posts.Title: Did anyone else develop a teensy consultant crush during their treatment...

Posts.Content: Hi, I am on day 10 after my first fec. I ended up in hospital for 4 days the day after my chemo, unable to eat or drink, so needed Iv fluids and sickness meds Iv. I have a huge sickness phobia and got into such a state,mi swore I wasn't going back for any further chemo. Anyway first day really of feeling halfway human again, although appetite still very low, but trying little and often. Options for my next poison have been to reduce the dose of chemo, and have my sickness meds via syringe driver. I've also to be referred to psychologist and I went to a hypnotherapist yesterday and I'm hopeful that'll help me. I'm just wondering if anyone had their chemo reduced and if this made a difference, and also has anyone had syringe driver for their sickness meds, and did this make a difference? Many thanks xxxxx
Posts.Title: Syringe driver for anti sickness meds

Posts.Content: I had my WLE and SNB yesterday in glasgow and found everything went to plan. I was diagnosed beginning of July so process so far has taken 7 weeks. The team were all lovely and helpful, I couldn't have asked for anything better. Today I'm feeling rather sore, I think I have a seroma (well there's defo a blister). I had to stay in overnight as I was out for the count all of the day and evening and felt sick. Back home now though and trying to get as comfy as possible. Love to all xxxx
Posts.Title: Not so great experiences with NHS - good news stories please!

Posts.Content: Hi, thank you all for replying. Moo46 what size was your lump as we seem to be similar? Really interesting to hear the oncologist personal opinion, I hope mine will tell me theirs as I think that would defo sway things. To say I am terrified is an understatement, I have a vomiting phobia and although all the other side affects would be horrible, the sickness part is what I worry about most (crazy I know in the scheme of things!!!). I had thought I'd got off lightly compared to some with only radiotherapy and tamoxifen in the pot, so this is a whole new ball game xxxx
Posts.Title: Help - Results today

Posts.Content: Hi, I had lumpectomy and SNB last Wednesday and went back today for results. Surgeon told me I had good clear margins and nodes were clear. However the cancer was grade 3 (9 mm, hormone + and her2 -) and I may now need chemo. I am totally gutted, I so did not expect to be told this. I've to meet with the oncologist to discuss whether chemo would be of benefit to me. My understanding is it's my decision?!?!?! I'm sure I read a post recently about someone in same position. My head is all over the place and I need some advice please
Posts.Title: Help - Results today

Posts.Content: Hi Lindsey, so sorry to hear your news. I will have all fingers and toes crossed for you for your second ops xxx
Posts.Title: New to this page! Diagnosed on 20th June aged 33!

Posts.Content: Hi Lindsey, so sorry to hear your news. I will have all fingers and toes crossed for you for your second ops xxx
Posts.Title: New to this page! Diagnosed on 20th June aged 33!

Posts.Content: Hi, thanks very much for replying. I work in an office but 98% of my day is computer work so didn't know if this might be too much for my arm after the SNB. As you say everyone is different so will just need to wait and see. I will be having radiotherapy and hormone therapy after my op if all goes according to plan!!! I won't be working through my radiotherapy as I have an hour drive each way and I need to try to fit my appointments in the middle of the day so that I can drop off and pick up my 9 year old at school (he goes back to school the day of my op :-( ) I have taken the news about my cancer in my stride up to now but I am getting a bit anxious now. I go for my pre op assessment this week so it's starting to feel real. I've never had surgery before so that's a bit scary. In the scheme of things though I am very lucky as I was only diagnosed after a routine scan so things could've been so much worse. Lots of love x
Posts.Title: Off work

Posts.Content: Hi, thank you all so much for sharing your experiences and advice with me. I was in having my pre op assessment yesterday and it's hitting home this is actually happening. Although I'm scared I just want it to hurry up now started and finished. Re work, I'm still worrying for some reason about how I'll get a sick note, but in the scheme of things I need to chill about it, it's not really important. Lots of love xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Off work

Posts.Content: Hi folks, I am booked in for a WLE and SNB on 20 August. Was diagnosed 3 weeks ago. I've been on holiday and due back at work next week, then off the following week for my op. My first question is how long do you think I'll be off work for. My boss has been asking and I've asked my GP and he said he doesn't know!!! My second question is this. I have never had planned sick leave before, so when do I get a sick line from my GP? Do I make an appoint before my op or do I self cert the first week and then go to GP? Thanks for reading!!
Posts.Title: Off work

Posts.Content: Hi, can it ask why radiotherapy won't be necessary? I was diagnosed 3 weeks ago and will be having a lumpectomy and SNB on 20 august, with radiotherapy and hormone therapy thereafter. I thought this was "normal" practice???
Posts.Title: Good News At Last

Posts.Content: Fabulous news and well done on weight loss xxx
Posts.Title: Good news!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi soniraeb, can if ask what your new approach on the anti sickness front was? Xxx
Posts.Title: Another side effect question
